books.title: Sartor Resartus
books.author: Thomas Carlyle
books.summary: The meta-fictional commentary on the life of “famous” German philosopher Diogenes Teufelsdröckh and his Philosophy of Clothes.

books.title: Tarzan and the Jewels of Opar
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: After seeking the riches of Opar, Tarzan must save his wife from captivity.

books.title: Yashka
books.author: Maria Bochkareva
books.summary: A Russian peasant leaves exile in Siberia to fight for her country in World War I.

books.title: Personal Recollections of Joan of Arc
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: A fictional biography of Joan of Arc from her early teenage years to her martyrdom.

books.title: The Getting of Wisdom
books.author: Henry Handel Richardson
books.summary: A girl from rural Victoria is sent to a prestigious boarding school in Melbourne, where she grows in prejudice and deceitfulness.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Edgar Allan Poe
books.summary: A collection of Edgar Allan Poe’s short fiction, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Julius Caesar
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: A play portraying the assassination of Julius Caesar.

books.title: The Blazing World
books.author: Margaret Cavendish
books.summary: A young lady is abducted and finds herself the empress of a strange new world.

books.title: The Bridal Wreath
books.author: Sigrid Undset
books.summary: In 14th-century Norway, a nobleman’s daughter grows up and faces passion, sin, and filial piety.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Edgar Allan Poe
books.summary: A collection of Edgar Allan Poe’s short fiction, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: The Life of Buffalo Bill
books.author: William F. Cody
books.summary: The 1879 autobiography of William F. Cody, more commonly known as Buffalo Bill, detailing his early life in the American West.

books.title: The Murder on the Links
books.author: Agatha Christie
books.summary: A famous Belgian detective and his sidekick are summoned to France to investigate the mysterious murder of a rich businessman.

books.title: Aspects of the Novel
books.author: E. M. Forster
books.summary: E. M. Forster offers an analysis of aspects of the novel.

books.title: The Servile State
books.author: Hilaire Belloc
books.summary: Hilaire Belloc’s thesis that the capitalist state breeds a collectivist theory which, in action, produces something utterly different from collectivism: the Servile State.

books.title: Gudrun
books.author: Anonymous
books.summary: A princess is captured by a jealous prince from a rival kingdom.

books.title: The Devil’s Dictionary
books.author: Ambrose Bierce
books.summary: A witty, sharp collection of sardonic word definitions from the 1800s and early 1900s that provide a snapshot into the irreverent humor of early American culture.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Algis Budrys
books.summary: Science fiction short stories by author Algis Budrys.

books.title: Vikram and the Vampire
books.author: Richard F. Burton
books.summary: King Vikram becomes trapped in a cycle of stories as he tries to capture a cunning vampire.

books.title: Heretics
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: A collection of essays in which G. K. Chesterton debates the intellectuals of his day on a range of topics.

books.title: Three Men in a Boat
books.author: Jerome K. Jerome
books.summary: The humorous travelogue of a boating holiday down the Thames taken by three friends and their dog.
